measured_by: Temporal Discounting Task (choice between immediate smaller vs delayed larger monetary rewards)
justification: "For the temporal discounting task, subjects were presented with two boxes on the screen with a monetary reward and asked to choose between the two… Subjects indicated which choice they wanted to pick with a button press, and were then required to hold down that button for the presented period of time."

measured_by: Discounting constant K from hyperbolic discounting function
justification: "We began by analyzing behavioral responses according to theories of temporal and delay discounting… modeled choices as a hyperbolic discounting function… the parameter K serves as a discounting constant."

measured_by: Spatial Discounting Task in virtual reality (navigating to boxes at varying distances)
justification: "For the spatial discounting task, subjects were placed in the VR environment… Two 3D boxes were again presented to the subject, but at variable distances… Subjects were then required to move the viewpoint via the joystick until they collided with their chosen reward."

measured_by: Discounting constant K from hyperbolic discounting function (distance-based choices)
justification: "Separate discounting functions were fit for all five speed values, yielding five discounting constants (K)… demonstrating that, as the walking speed increased, values of K decreased."
